alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 4:06AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jim Hogg, Starr and southeastern Zapata Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 405 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Santa Catarina to 9 miles south of Santa Cruz. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rio Grande City, Roma, Sullivan City, Escobares, El Sauz, Viboras, Garciasville, La Rosita, La Grulla and La Victoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
